docinfo.docinfo:doc-heading: DIVISION 2 ENFORCEMENT OF WRITS AGAINST LAND [rr 39.21–39.28]

heading.title: DIVISION 2 ENFORCEMENT OF WRITS AGAINST LAND [rr 39.21–39.28]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: DIVISION 2 ENFORCEMENT OF WRITS AGAINST LAND [rr 39.21–39.28]
[r 39.21] r 39.21 Judgment creditor’s notice to judgment debtor (cf DCR Part 36, rule 2; LCR Part 30A, rule 3)

leg:heading.title: Judgment creditor’s notice to judgment debtor (cf DCR Part 36, rule 2; LCR Part 30A, rule 3)

p.text: A judgment creditor may file an affidavit verifying:
the registration of a writ for the levy of property:
in the Register kept under the Real Property Act 1900, pursuant to section 105 of that Act, or
in the General Register of Deeds kept under the Conveyancing Act 1919, pursuant to section 186 of that Act, and
the receipt by the judgment creditor of advice from the Sheriff to the effect that the Sheriff cannot obtain satisfaction of the writ by proceeding further against the goods of the judgment debtor.

Section 72 of the Fines Act 1996 provides that a property seizure order under that section operates as a writ for the levy of property issued by the Local Court and, for that purpose, that the State Debt Recovery Office is taken to be the judgment creditor.
[subr (1) am Amendment 22 of 2008 r 2 and Sch 1[14], effective 8 August 2008; Amendment 19 of 2007 r 3 and Sch 2[1], effective 6 July 2009]
A copy of the advice referred to in subrule (1)(b) must be annexed to the affidavit.
[subr (1A) insrt Amendment 22 of 2008 r 2 and Sch 1[15], effective 8 August 2008]

On filing an affidavit referred to in subrule (1) the judgment creditor may lodge with the registrar in duplicate, and the registrar must seal, a notice (the judgment creditor’s notice) advising the judgment debtor of the following:
that a writ for the levy of property has been registered as referred to in subrule (1)(a),
that the judgment creditor intends that land of the judgment debtor be sold after the lapse of 4 weeks,
that the judgment debtor is entitled to sell or mortgage the land, but only in accordance with section 113 of the Civil Procedure Act 2005,
that the judgment debtor is entitled to apply for an instalment order under section 107 of the Civil Procedure Act 2005.
[subr (2) am Amendment 11 of 2006 r 2 and Sch 1[24], effective 8 December 2006]
A sealed copy of the judgment creditor’s notice is to be served on the judgment debtor.
The approved form for a judgment creditor’s notice is Form 67.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [r 39.22] r 39.22 Judgment creditor’s application for sale (cf DCR Part 36, rules 4 and 6; LCR Part 30A, rules 5 and 7)

leg:heading.title: Judgment creditor’s application for sale (cf DCR Part 36, rules 4 and 6; LCR Part 30A, rules 5 and 7)

p.text: Land may not be sold under a writ for the levy of property until the following steps have been completed:
the judgment creditor has filed an affidavit of service of a judgment creditor’s notice under rule 39.21 ,
the judgment creditor has filed a notice of sale in the approved form (the notice of sale) and lodged 6 copies of it with the registrar,
the registrar has sealed each copy of the notice of sale so lodged and returned them to the judgment creditor,
the judgment creditor has given the 6 sealed copies of the notice of sale to the Sheriff,
if required to do so under rule 39.3A , the judgment creditor has informed the Sheriff, in accordance with that rule, as to whether any person is in occupation of the land,
the Sheriff has fixed a date for the sale of the land, being a date occurring not less than 4 weeks after the date on which the judgment creditor’s notice was served on the judgment debtor,
the Sheriff has inserted the date so fixed in each copy of the notice of sale,
the Sheriff has returned 2 copies of the notice of sale, in which the date for the sale of the land has been inserted, to the judgment creditor,

at least one week before the date for the sale of the land, the judgment creditor has served a copy of the notice of sale, in which the date for the sale of the land has been inserted, on the judgment debtor,

the judgment creditor has furnished to the Sheriff such information as in his or her possession, or as he or she can reasonably obtain, that is relevant to the ascertainment of the value of the interest to be sold, including:
particulars of the value most recently assigned by the Valuer-General to the land the subject of the interest, and
particulars of the title to that land as revealed by a recent search at the office of the Registrar-General.
[subr (1) am Amendment 29 of 2009 Sch 1[14], effective 8 October 2009]

The approved form referred to in subrule (1)(b) must contain a statement reminding the judgment debtor of his or her right to apply for an instalment order under section 107 of the Civil Procedure Act 2005.
The approved form for a notice of sale is Form 68.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [r 39.23] r 39.23 Sale to be publicly advertised (cf DCR Part 36, rule 8; LCR Part 30A, rule 9)

leg:heading.title: Sale to be publicly advertised (cf DCR Part 36, rule 8; LCR Part 30A, rule 9)

p.text: The Sheriff, or the auctioneer appointed by the Sheriff, must cause an advertisement of any sale of land, including a full description of the land, to be published in the Gazette, and in a newspaper circulating in the district in which the land is situated, at least one week before the date fixed for the sale.

The sale of any land under a writ for the levy of property may, in addition to being advertised under subrule (1), be further advertised by the Sheriff, or the auctioneer appointed to sell the land, if the further advertisement is approved by the Sheriff.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [r 39.24] r 39.24 Proof of service and publication (cf DCR Part 36, rule 9; LCR Part 30A, rule 10)

leg:heading.title: Proof of service and publication (cf DCR Part 36, rule 9; LCR Part 30A, rule 10)

p.text: Before the sale of any land takes place under a writ for the levy of property, the judgment creditor must lodge with the Sheriff an affidavit as to:
the service on the judgment debtor of the notice of sale under rule 39.22, and
the date and particulars of publication of each advertisement published under rule 39.23 in relation to the sale.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [r 39.25] r 39.25 Satisfaction by judgment debtor (cf DCR Part 36, rule 7; LCR Part 30A, rule 8)

leg:heading.title: Satisfaction by judgment debtor (cf DCR Part 36, rule 7; LCR Part 30A, rule 8)

p.text: If, before or at the time fixed for the sale of land under a writ for the levy of property, the judgment debtor indicates to the Sheriff, or to the auctioneer appointed to sell the land, that the judgment debtor intends to satisfy the writ, the judgment debtor must pay to the Sheriff or auctioneer:
the amount due under the judgment, including interest, and
the costs of the execution then known to the Sheriff or auctioneer, including any fees payable in respect of the execution to an auctioneer, and
an amount determined by the Sheriff as security for the judgment creditor’s costs of the execution other than those referred to in paragraph (b),
and, on receipt of the money, the Sheriff or auctioneer must cancel the sale.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [r 39.26] r 39.26 Documents giving effect to sale

p.text: If land is sold at auction under a writ for the levy of property, the Sheriff and the purchaser must each sign an appropriate contract of sale forthwith after the auction is completed.

As soon as practicable after receiving payment in full for land sold under a writ for the levy of property, an appropriate conveyance or transfer (to be prepared by the purchaser) must be executed by the Sheriff and delivered to the purchaser for the purpose of giving effect to the sale.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [r 39.27] r 39.27 Sheriff or auctioneer to report (cf DCR Part 36, rule 12; LCR Part 30A, rule 15)

leg:heading.title: Sheriff or auctioneer to report (cf DCR Part 36, rule 12; LCR Part 30A, rule 15)

p.text: As soon as practicable after the sale of land under a writ for the levy of property has been completed, the Sheriff or auctioneer appointed to sell land must make a report to the registrar as to:
the approximate market value of the land fixed by the Sheriff, and
the amount of the highest bid at the sale, and
whether or not the judgment debtor was identified to the Sheriff or auctioneer as being present at the sale, and
the amount of the auctioneer’s charges, and
any other matter which the Sheriff or auctioneer considers should be reported to the registrar.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [r 39.28] r 39.28 Payment to judgment debtor (cf DCR Part 36, rule 13; LCR Part 30A, rule 16)

leg:heading.title: Payment to judgment debtor (cf DCR Part 36, rule 13; LCR Part 30A, rule 16)

p.text: A judgment creditor at whose request a writ for the levy of property has been issued may file:
evidence of an agreement with the judgment debtor as to the amount of the judgment creditor’s costs of the execution, or
a notice of motion for the assessment of those costs.
Any evidence or notice of motion referred to in subrule (1) must be filed within 2 months after the receipt by the issuing registrar of:
the proceeds of sale of any land, or
any money under section 113(5) of the Civil Procedure Act 2005, or
any money under rule 39.25,
or within such further time as may be consented to in writing by the judgment debtor.

If the judgment creditor files any evidence or notice in accordance with subrule (2), the registrar must as soon as practicable pay to the judgment debtor any money held by the registrar over and above the amount necessary to satisfy the writ for the levy of property.
If the judgment creditor:
does not file any evidence or notice in accordance with subrule (2), and
does not within the time allowed in that regard advise the registrar of any consent by the judgment debtor to extend that time,

the registrar may pay to the judgment debtor any money mentioned in subrule (2) and held by the registrar over and above the total of the amount necessary to satisfy the judgment (including interest) and the costs of the execution (other than solicitor’s profit costs) then known to the registrar.
The registrar must pay to the judgment creditor any money referred to in this rule that the registrar is not by this rule required to pay to the judgment debtor.
Nothing in this rule affects the right of the judgment creditor to recover against the judgment debtor the costs of execution of the writ for the levy of property.
